info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Catawba, eastern Rutherford, western Lincoln, Cleveland, western Gaston, southeastern Burke, western York, east central Spartanburg, Cherokee and northern Union Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 414 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles south of Morganton to 11 miles east of Spartanburg. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Shelby, Gaffney, York, Kings Mountain, Cherryville, Bessemer City, Longview, Boiling Springs NC and Pacolet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
